tip: Did you know? The Kenyan Constitution guarantees every citizen the right to access information held by the state.
Did you know? You can petition Parliament directly to make or change laws.
Did you know? Kenya has 47 devolved county governments to bring services closer to the people.
Did you know? Public participation is a constitutional right in all decision-making processes.
Did you know? Every Kenyan child has the right to free and compulsory basic education.
Did you know? Kiswahili is Kenya’s national language, while both English and Kiswahili are official languages.
Did you know? You have the right to clean and safe water under Kenya’s Constitution.
Did you know? The Constitution of Kenya recognizes and protects the rights of minorities and marginalized groups.
Did you know? You can access county budgets, expenditures, and plans through the county’s official website.
